text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

CORN SALE - Taiwan's CK group on Tuesday bought a shipment of 54,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 corn from TradiGrain of the United States, traders said. The CK Group is comprised of Chia Hsin Flour Feed and Vegetable Oil Corp and some buyers from Taiwan's southern port city of Kaohsiung. Shipment was for August.
WHEAT TENDERS - The CCC tendered Tuesday for 60,000 tonnes of US HRW wheat for July 16-31 shipment for donation to Kyrgyzstan.

SOYMEAL TENDER - The Commodity Credit Corp reduced the soymeal tonnage it seeks for Guatemala to 1,389 tonnes from 4,560 tonnes, the CCC said Tuesday. All other details were unchanged. The tender was set for Wednesday with shipment to be July 17-31.

RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foodstuffs (GEZA) on Monday issued an international tender to buy 24,000 tonnes of white rice for August delivery, a GEZA spokesman said. He told Reuters that July 23 was set as the final date to submit offers and that results would be made available on July 24.

MARKET TALK - Iran expects to import three million tonnes of wheat from Australia and 2.5 million tonnes from Canada in the year to March 1998, an Iranian official said in remarks published on Tuesday.

MARKET TALK - The U.S Agriculture Department said Tuesday that it will donate 3,000 tonnes of soymeal to the former Soviet republic of Georgia. USDA is making the donation under its fiscal 1997 (October-September) Food for Progres program. The soymeal will be sold in a sealed bid auction in Georgia to raise funds to support rural credit and agricultural education initiatives there, USDA said.
MARKET TALK - The European Union will raise duties on transatlantic imports of medium quality soft wheat on Wednesday to 53.04 Ecus per tonne from 46.46 Ecus, European Commission figures showed.
